identificationModule.briefTitle: National Egyptian Network Pediatric Stroke and Hemiplegia Registry
identificationModule.officialTitle: National Egyptian Network Pediatric Stroke and Hemiplegia Registry

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Our aim is to establish multi-center national Egyptian database of information about cerebrovascular stroke and hemiplegia in infants and children from 0 to 18 years of age.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Aims: An open-ended multi-center, national Egyptian study to collect and analyze data for children with cerebrovascular stroke and hemiplegia .

Participants: Eligible infants and children with stroke and hemiplegia.

DESIGN: This study is a prospective cohort study.

Primary outcome measure: Initial acute stroke clinical and radiological presentation, recurrent stroke, mortality, and neurologic deficits in the acute stage, participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 6 weeks

armGroups.label: Pediatric Stroke and Hemiplegia
armGroups.description: Any infant or child with acute stroke or hemiplegia

primaryOutcomes.measure: Survival or neurologic deficit after acute cerebrovascular stroke.
primaryOutcomes.description: Children with acute stroke will be followed till either death or discharge from hospital, all clinical, radiological and therapeutic data will be collected.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 6 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Post-stroke pediatric gross and fine motor function will be assessed.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Focal neurological deficit of acute onset lasting greater than 20 minutes. And CT or MRI showing infarct in location consistent with neurological signs and symptoms
* Hemiplegia

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Cerebral haemorrhage not associated with ischemic infarct.
2. Hypoxic ischemic event with diffuse or bilateral infarction alone.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All children from birth to 18 years of age with acute stroke presented by focal neurological signs confirmed by neuroradiology CT or MRI. All children with hemiplegia till the age of 18 years.
